item.title: Russia has disciplined 30,000 soldiers for corruption this year as bribery threatens to undermine Putin’s war economy
item.description: Russia has fired hundreds of soldiers for a "loss of trust" as country's economy wanes from drawn out battle in Ukraine.

item.title: Biden approves minimum oil lease sale required by law in Alaska’s Arctic refuge
item.description: The sale will include a fraction of the land total that was available for bidding roughly four years ago in a sale held during the Trump administratio...

item.title: Help Fortune find Europe’s Most Innovative Companies 2025
item.description: Fortune is partnering with market research and data company Statista to look for Europe's Most Innovative Companies, and you can help with the search.

item.title: Nvidia slapped with a Chinese antitrust probe as Beijing collects ‘bargaining chips’ ahead of Trump’s return
item.description: An analyst from the consultancy firm Trivium China thinks Beijing is preparing for some tough negotiations ahead.

item.title: What keeps space entrepreneurs up at night
item.description: Hostile nation states know the U.S. is dependent on space and aren't shy about hacking its infrastructure.
